item.title: China convenes Huawei, Tencent, Baidu to draft metaverse standards in bid to become global technology leader
item.description:
Summary：

In response to the evolving metaverse industry, China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) has established a working group comprised of 60 experts. The group includes representatives from technology companies, government officials, and academics. Their mission is to develop and promote industry standards, address ethical and security challenges, and foster talent development in the metaverse sector. Furthermore, the group aims to contribute to international standard-setting activities.
  • Abstract: China forms a working group to establish metaverse industry standards.
  • Theme: Regulating the emerging metaverse sector through standardisation, addressing challenges, and promoting innovation.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of standardisation in guiding the healthy development of the metaverse industry.
  • Main information: Composition of the working group; responsibilities in standard-building, promotion, and talent training; focus on domestic and international standards.

总结：

为了应对不断发展的元宇宙产业，中国工业和信息化部成立了一个由 60 名专家组成的专家组。该小组包括来自技术公司、政府官员和学者的代表。他们的任务是制定和促进行业标准，应对道德和安全挑战，并促进元宇宙领域的培养人才发展。此外，该小组旨在为国际标准制定活动做出贡献。
  • 摘要：中国成立工作组制定元宇宙产业标准。
  • 主题：通过标准化、应对挑战和促进创新来规范新兴元宇宙领域。
  • 观点：标准化在指导元宇宙产业健康发展中的重要性。
  • 主要信息：工作组的组成；在标准制定、推广和人才培养方面的职责；对国内和国际标准的关注。

单词：

  • metaverse (n.) - 元宇宙。

    原文例句：China has formed a working group to establish metaverse standards.

    例句讲解：“元宇宙”一词源于“meta”（超越）和“universe”（宇宙），指的是一个超越现实世界的虚拟世界。它通常与虚拟现实、增强现实和混合现实等技术相关联。

  • standardisation (n.) - 标准化。

    原文例句：The group is tasked with building, maintaining and promoting metaverse industry standards.

    例句讲解：“标准化”一词是指建立和实施统一的标准的过程。它可以应用于各种领域，包括产品、流程和服务。在元宇宙领域，标准化对于确保互操作性、安全性和可靠性至关重要。

  • ethical (adj.) - 符合道德的。

    原文例句：The MIIT in September proposed to form a working group to “guide the healthy and orderly development of the metaverse industry through standard regulation”, cautioning that the sector was facing ethical and security challenges.

    例句讲解：“符合道德的”一词是指符合社会公认的道德准则和价值观。在元宇宙领域，道德问题包括用户数据保护、虛拟世界中的行为准则和虚拟资产所有权等。

词组：

  • form a working group - 成立工作组。

    原文例句：China has formed a working group to establish metaverse standards.

    例句讲解：“成立工作组”一词是指组建一个由专家和利益相关者组成的小组，负责特定任务或项目的执行。工作组通常具有临时性质，在完成任务后解散。

  • build and maintain a system - 建立并维护一个系统。

    原文例句：The group would be tasked with “building and maintaining a system of metaverse industry standards”.

    例句讲解：“建立并维护一个系统”一词是指创建一个结构化和一致的框架，并不断更新和改进它以满足不断变化的需求。在元宇宙领域，标准体系对于确保行业的有序发展至关重要。

  • deeply engage in - 深度参与。

    原文例句：Besides focusing on domestic standards, the group would also “encourage local companies and institutions to deeply engage in international standard-setting activities”.

    例句讲解：“深度参与”一词是指积极参与并做出重大贡献。在元宇宙领域，深度参与国际标准制定活动对于影响行业发展方向和确保中国企业在全球市场的竞争力至关重要。

句子：

  • The metaverse, a loosely-defined term that refers to a virtual three-dimensional world, has become a trending topic in the past few years. - 元宇宙，一个宽泛的术语，指的是一个虚拟的三维世界，近年来已成为一个热门话题。

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是The metaverse，谓语是has become a trending topic in the past few years。a loosely-defined term that refers to a virtual three-dimensional world是一个现在分词短语作定语，修饰主语The metaverse，表示元宇宙是一个宽泛的术语，指的是一个虚拟的三维世界。in the past few years是一个介词短语作时间状语，表示近年来。这个句子的意思是说，元宇宙是一个宽泛的术语，指的是一个虚拟的三维世界，近年来已成为一个热门话题。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示过去发生的动作或状态延续到现在。

    原文例句：China has formed a working group to establish metaverse standards.

    语法讲解：现在完成时态结构是：have/has + 过去分词。have/has根据主语的人称和数进行变化。现在完成时态表示过去发生的动作或状态延续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，China has formed a working group to establish metaverse standards这句话表示中国已经组建了一个工作组来制定元宇宙标准，这个动作发生在过去，但其影响延续到了现在，因此使用现在完成时态。

  • The working group consists of 60 experts, including those from the private sector as well as government officials and academic researchers
  • The group is tasked with building, maintaining and promoting metaverse industry standards, China’s technology regulator says

China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) has assembled 60 experts, including some from the country’s largest technology firms, to form a new working group to establish standards for the metaverse sector.

Representatives from telecoms equipment giant Huawei Technologies, video gaming titans Tencent Holdings and NetEase, web search and artificial intelligence champion Baidu, financial technology firm Ant Group and computer maker Lenovo Group are among those on the list published by the MIIT on Friday.

Ant is an affiliate of Alibaba Group Holding, owner of the Post.

Other members include MIIT officials and researchers from Peking University, Fudan University and other renowned institutions in the country.

The MIIT in September proposed to form a working group to “guide the healthy and orderly development of the metaverse industry through standard regulation”, cautioning that the sector was facing ethical and security challenges.

The group would be tasked with “building and maintaining a system of metaverse industry standards”, “promoting the standards” and “training talent”, the regulator said in its proposal.

Besides focusing on domestic standards, the group would also “encourage local companies and institutions to deeply engage in international standard-setting activities”.

The metaverse, a loosely-defined term that refers to a virtual three-dimensional world, has become a trending topic in the past few years.

US social media giant Facebook changed its name to Meta Platforms in 2021. CEO and founder Mark Zuckerberg explained during the rebranding announcement that he sought to embrace “the next chapter for the internet”.

In 2022, Meta, Microsoft and others founded the Metaverse Standards Forum, which also comprises Huawei, Tencent and some other Chinese tech giants.

Beijing is hoping to become a leader in the emerging field. Five authorities, including the MIIT, released a joint plan last year to nurture at least three metaverse companies “with global influence” by 2025.

Several local governments have made it a priority to develop the metaverse sector.

Beijing’s eastern Tongzhou district, considered a “sub-centre” of the capital city, has vowed to incorporate more than 100 metaverse-related firms by the end of the year.

Shanghai has planned to set up both government-backed and private funds dedicated to metaverse development. The first one, established in late 2022, raised an initial sum of 1 billion yuan (US$140 million).

item.title: TuSimple will continue its drive to Asia-Pacific in wake of autonomous truck firm’s decision to delist from Nasdaq
item.description:
Summary：

美国自动驾驶卡车公司图森未来计划从纳斯达克退市，并将战略重心转向亚太市场，包括中国、日本和澳大利亚，以更好地实现商业化目标，并配合退市计划。公司首席执行官吕程表示，聚焦亚太地区有助于整合先进软件和可靠的硬件，以实现自动驾驶卡车的商业化目标。公司已在日本进行自动驾驶汽车的测试，并在上海公开道路上进行无人驾驶测试。由于缺乏清晰的盈利路径、硬件供应链和监管问题，自动驾驶行业面临严峻挑战。
  • Abstract: TuSimple To Shift Focus To APAC, Citing Regulatory Support and a Strong Supply Chain.
  • Theme: TuSimple, an autonomous truck company, plans to shift its focus from the US to the Asia-Pacific region due to favorable regulatory support and a robust supply chain.
  • Viewpoint: The transition to APAC reflects TuSimple's strategic priorities to pursue commercial opportunities and navigate challenges in the autonomous driving industry.
  • Main information: TuSimple's intention to delist from Nasdaq and its move towards APAC; the challenges in achieving profitability and commercialization in the autonomous driving sector.

总结：

图森未来，一家自动驾驶卡车公司，计划从纳斯达克退市，并将战略重心转向亚太市场，包括中国、日本和澳大利亚。这一举措旨在更好的实现商业化目标，并配合退市计划。公司首席执行官吕程表示，聚焦亚太地区有助于整合先进软件和可靠的硬件，以实现自动驾驶卡车的商业化目标。图森未来已在日本进行自动驾驶汽车的测试，并在上海公开道路上进行无人驾驶测试。由于缺乏清晰的盈利路径、硬件供应链和监管问题，自动驾驶行业面临严峻挑战。
  • 摘要：图森未来转向亚太地区，寻求监管支持和强大的供应链。
  • 主题：图森未来，一家自动驾驶卡车公司，计划将重点从美国转移到亚太地区，这是由于该地区有利的监管支持和强大的供应链。
  • 观点：向亚太地区的转型反映了图森未来的战略重点，即追求商业机会并在自动驾驶行业克服挑战。
  • 主要信息：图森未来打算从纳斯达克退市，以及向亚太地区迈进；自动驾驶行业在实现盈利和商业化方面面临的挑战。

单词：

  • regulatory support (n.) - 监管支持。

    原文例句：TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC, including China, Japan and Australia, where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help the firm’s commercial goals, Lu said in a Friday interview,.

    例句讲解：“regulatory support”意为“监管支持”。在这个句子中，它指的是中国、日本和澳大利亚等亚太国家对自动驾驶汽车发展的支持性政策和法规。

  • supply chain (n.) - 供应链。

    原文例句：That’s one of the benefits of focusing our business more on APAC because of the maturity of the hardware supply chain.”

    例句讲解：“supply chain”意为“供应链”。在这个句子中，它指的是亚太地区的汽车硬件供应链体系，包括零部件供应、生产制造、物流运输等环节。

  • Tier-1 components (n.) - 一级零部件。

    原文例句：“For autonomous trucks, we have to integrate the advanced software capabilities – the virtual driver – with reliable and scalable hardware that includes the truck itself, Tier-1 components coupled with the right use case,” Lu said.

    例句讲解：“Tier-1 components”意为“一级零部件”。在这个句子中，它指的是汽车制造中由一级供应商提供的核心零部件，如发动机、变速箱、车身等。

词组：

  • last trading day - 最后交易日。

    原文例句：TuSimple this week announced a plan to voluntarily delist from Nasdaq, with its last trading day expected to be around February 7

    例句讲解：“last trading day”意为“最后交易日”。在这个句子中，它指的是图森未来股票在纳斯达克交易所的最后一个交易日，预计为 2 月 7 日左右。

句子：

  • TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC, including China, Japan and Australia, where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help the firm’s commercial goals, Lu said in a Friday interview, as the self-driving industry continues to push for profitability. - 图森未来正在将战略重心转向包括中国、日本和澳大利亚在内的亚太地区，吕程在周五的采访中说，因为那里的监管支持和强大的供应链可以帮助公司实现商业目标，同时自动驾驶行业也在继续追求盈利能力。

    句子分析：这是一个长句，包含着许多信息。主句是TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC，其中主语是TuSimple，谓语是is shifting，宾语是focus。in a Friday interview，as the self-driving industry continues to push for profitability是两个分词短语，分别作时间状语和原因状语。where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help the firm’s commercial goals是一个定语从句，修饰APAC。这个句子的大意是：图森未来正在将战略重心转向包括中国、日本和澳大利亚在内的亚太地区，吕程在周五的采访中说，因为那里的监管支持和强大的供应链可以帮助公司实现商业目标，同时自动驾驶行业也在继续追求盈利能力。

语法：

  • 分词短语作状语 - 动词的-ing形式或过去分词形式加上必要的成分，构成分词短语，作状语。

    原文例句：TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC, including China, Japan and Australia, where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help the firm’s commercial goals, Lu said in a Friday interview, as the self-driving industry continues to push for profitability.

    语法讲解：分词短语作状语是指动词的-ing形式或过去分词形式加上必要的成分，构成分词短语，作状语。分词短语作状语可以表示时间、原因、条件、让步等各种状语的意义。在这个句子中，in a Friday interview和as the self-driving industry continues to push for profitability都是分词短语作状语，分别表示时间和原因。

  • TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC, including China, Japan and Australia, where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help
  • TuSimple this week announced a plan to voluntarily delist from Nasdaq, with its last trading day expected to be around February 7

Autonomous truck company TuSimple Holdings will continue to pivot to the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region for better commercial opportunities and in line with its plan to delist from the Nasdaq exchange, said chief executive officer Lu Cheng.

TuSimple is shifting its focus to APAC, including China, Japan and Australia, where regulatory support and a strong supply chain can help the firm’s commercial goals, Lu said in a Friday interview, as the self-driving industry continues to push for profitability.

“For autonomous trucks, we have to integrate the advanced software capabilities – the virtual driver – with reliable and scalable hardware that includes the truck itself, Tier-1 components coupled with the right use case,” Lu said. “That’s one of the benefits of focusing our business more on APAC because of the maturity of the hardware supply chain.”

The company started test runs of Level 4 autonomous trucks in Japan last year, and conducted full autonomous runs – without a human in the truck – on public roads in Shanghai. Level 4 is considered to be fully autonomous driving, although a human driver can still request control, and the car still has a cockpit.

San Diego, California-based TuSimple, which carried out an initial public offering (IPO) in 2021, announced its plan to voluntarily delist from Nasdaq on Wednesday, with its last trading day on the exchange expected to be around February 7.

The company cited changes in the capital markets for “pre-commercialised companies” and significantly increased stock price volatility as part of its rationale for delisting. It also said being a private firm would help the company better navigate its transformation.

The company’s shares closed at US$0.49 on Thursday, trading around 98 per cent lower than its debut price of US$40.

Autonomous trucking firm TuSimple to exit US amid new lay-offs, focus on Asia

Lu said the company could explore another IPO down the road “when the company makes more progress and the market conditions make sense”, but it has no timeline or location in mind at the present time.

TuSimple said last month that it was cutting 75 per cent of its workforce and winding down its operations in the US. The retreat comes amid further consolidation in the autonomous driving industry, with several leading players announcing lay-offs and downsizing in the past year.

Last July, Alphabet unit Waymo announced that it would slow down work in the self-driving truck field under its Via subsidiary. Last May, Embark Technology – an early proponent of self-driving truck software development in the US – delisted from the Nasdaq and went private via a merger, after running out of capital to pursue commercial production.

The lack of a clear path to profitability and real commercialisation is a challenge for the industry, which includes technology, hardware supply chain, and regulatory issues, Lu said. “Being able to move from demos and pilots to actually providing a real service that is profitable is the biggest challenge,” he added.

TuSimple reported a US$248.6 million loss from operations in the first nine months of 2023, narrowing from a US$341.7 million loss in the same period in the previous year.

TuSimple, once considered a star in the global autonomous driving sector and a leader in US self-driving truck development, has focused on Level 4 autonomy. It was also the first company to deploy autonomous trucks on pilot tests between the cities of Tucson and Phoenix in Arizona and Las Vegas, Nevada in 2018.

The company has been grappling with a US government investigation, corporate disputes and lay-offs since 2022.

The US Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS), an inter-agency panel that reviews the national security implications of foreign investments in the US, kicked off an investigation of TuSimple with the FBI and the Securities and Exchange Commission in 2022.

The inquiry revolves around whether TuSimple co-founder and then-chief executive Hou Xiaodi made illegal funding or technology transfers to Hydron, a Chinese autonomous truck start-up established by another TuSimple co-founder Chen Mo in 2021.

How was fired by the company’s board in October 2022 after an internal investigation, with it citing a “loss in trust and confidence” in connection with the alleged sharing of confidential information with Hydron.

item.title: Hong Kong eyes ‘more flexible’ path in regulating spot cryptocurrency ETFs as US races ahead with approvals
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Hong Kong's proposed rules for spot cryptocurrency ETFs differ from those in the US, allowing both cash and in-kind subscriptions, enabling participating dealers to use bitcoin directly for ETF transactions.
  • The US, with its faster approval process and larger market, remains a strong competitor to Hong Kong's ambitions of becoming a cryptocurrency hub.
  • Hong Kong's regulators are more open to virtual asset ETFs due to regulated spot virtual asset transactions on licensed platforms, providing optimism for the city's potential as a cryptocurrency center.

中文总结：

  • 香港拟议的现货加密货币ETF规则与美国不同，允许现金和实物认购，使参与交易商可以直接使用比特币认购或赎回ETF份额。
  • 美国在审批速度和市场规模方面领先，对香港成为加密货币枢纽的野心构成有力竞争。
  • 香港监管机构对虚拟资产ETF持更开放态度，因为在获得许可的平台上进行的现货虚拟资产交易受到监管，这对这座城市作为加密货币中心的潜力提供乐观情绪。

单词：

  • divergence (n.) - /daɪˈvɜːrdʒəns/ 分歧。

    原文例句：The different approach reflects a divergence of virtual asset regulatory frameworks.

    例句讲解：这个单词由di-（分离）和verge（转动）构成，意为“使分别，使发散，使分离”，即“分歧，分离”。在这个例句中，它指的是虚拟资产监管框架的分歧。

  • illict (adj.) - /ɪˈlɪsɪt/ 非法的，违法的。

    原文例句：SEC chair Gary Gensler said that despite its approval of spot bitcoin ETFs, the regulator “did not approve or endorse bitcoin”, which is “primarily a speculative, volatile asset that’s also used for illicit activity including ransomware, money laundering, sanction evasion, and terrorist financing”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，由in-（不）和licitus（合法，合法的）构成，意为“不合法，非法的”。在这个例句中，它指的是非法活动。

  • navigate (v.) - /ˈnævɪgeɪt/ 导航，驾驭。

    原文例句：positions it well in navigating the evolving world of digital assets

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，由navis（船）和agere（做，行动）构成，意为“驾驶船，驾驭，导航”。在这个例句中，它指的是驾驭数码资产的不断变化的世界。

词组：

  • spot bitcoin - 现货比特币。

    原文例句：US, offered by fund giants including BlackRock and Fidelity, attracted nearly US$2 billion in their first three days of trading.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由spot（现货，現貨）和bitcoin（比特币，比特幣）构成的，表示“现货比特币”。在这个例句中，它指的是由基金巨头黑石和富达等提供的现货比特币ETF，在交易的前三天吸引了近20亿美元。

  • virtual asset - 虚拟资产。

    原文例句：Regulators in Hong Kong last month said that they will allow retail access to spot virtual asset ETFs.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由virtual（虚拟的）和asset（资产，資產）构成的，表示“虚拟资产”。在这个例句中，它指的是监管机构上个月表示将允许散户参与现货虚拟资产ETF。

句子：

  • The different approach reflects a divergence of virtual asset regulatory frameworks. - 不同的方法反映了虚拟资产监管框架的分歧。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是The different approach reflects，其中主语是The different approach，谓语是reflects。a divergence of virtual asset regulatory frameworks是一个介词短语作宾语，表示分歧，即虚拟资产监管框架的分歧。这个句子的意思是说，不同的方法反映了虚拟资产监管框架的分歧。

语法：

  • that引导的定语从句 - 用于限制先行词，指出先行词的特征或性质。

    原文例句：The American cryptocurrency market is poised to be much larger for US and world investors, especially when the ones offering the spot cryptocurrency ETFs are finance heavyweights such as Blackrock, Fidelity, Franklin, and Invesco.

    语法讲解：这是一个that引导的定语从句，修饰先行词The American cryptocurrency market，表示美国加密货币市场即将变得更大。such as Blackrock, Fidelity, Franklin, and Invesco.是一个插入语，提供有关所提供现货加密货币ETF的更多信息。这个句子的意思是说，美国加密货币市场即将变得更大，特别是当提供现货加密货币ETF的是像Blackrock，Fidelity，Franklin和Invesco这样的金融巨头时。

  • 强调句 - 用于强调句子中的某个成分。

    原文例句：They have a huge existing customer base and a brand that retail investors feel comfortable with.」

    语法讲解：这是一个强调句，强调的是They have a huge existing customer base and a brand that retail investors feel comfortable with.。结构是：It is/was + 被强调成分 + that/who + 其他。在这个例句中，被强调成分是They have a huge existing customer base and a brand that retail investors feel comfortable with.。这个句子的意思是说，他们拥有庞大的现有客户群和一个让散户投资者感到舒适的品牌。

  • A key difference between Hong Kong’s proposed rules for spot cryptocurrency ETFs and the US is that the city will allow both cash and in-kind subscriptions
  • The SFC and Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s plan to authorise spot cryptocurrency ETFs has given the industry optimism about the city’s prospects of becoming a cryptocurrency hub

Hong Kong is set to develop a more flexible regime for cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds (ETFs), even though the US leads in both approval speed and market size, experts said.

A key difference between Hong Kong’s proposed rules for spot cryptocurrency ETFs and products approved in the US is that Hong Kong will allow both cash and in-kind subscriptions. Under such rules, participating dealers can directly use bitcoin to subscribe to or redeem the ETF’s shares, whereas in the US, such subscriptions and redemptions are only allowed with cash.

The different approach reflects a divergence of virtual asset regulatory frameworks, where the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) “appears reluctant to allow licensed dealers to touch bitcoin” when subscribing for and redeeming ETF shares because spot bitcoin trades are unregulated in the US, according to Andrew Fei, a partner at King & Wood Mallesons in Hong Kong.

Hong Kong securities watchdog puts virtual asset trading platforms on fraud alert

Regulators in Hong Kong last month said that they will allow retail access to spot virtual asset ETFs, and are willing to accept applications from funds hoping to offer such products to the public.

After nine spot bitcoin ETFs in the US, offered by fund giants including BlackRock and Fidelity, attracted nearly US$2 billion in their first three days of trading, virtual asset industry participants in Hong Kong have urged the Hong Kong government to speed up the approval of the city’s own offerings.

“I hope that Hong Kong, amid the rapid development and intense competition in the virtual asset sector, can seize a spot globally as quickly as possible,” Legislative Council member Johnny Ng Kit-chong wrote in a post on X, formerly Twitter, last week. “[Hong Kong should] strive to be the first to implement relevant policies and products particularly in Asia.”

Hong Kong regulators propose licensing for sale of stablecoins to public

In a statement last week, SEC chair Gary Gensler said that despite its approval of spot bitcoin ETFs, the regulator “did not approve or endorse bitcoin”, which is “primarily a speculative, volatile asset that’s also used for illicit activity including ransomware, money laundering, sanction evasion, and terrorist financing”.

“In the US, the spot bitcoin market is largely unregulated and the SEC remains somewhat sceptical about spot bitcoin transactions,” Fei said.

However, because spot virtual asset transactions on licensed virtual asset trading platforms are regulated in Hong Kong, the city’s Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) “appears to be more comfortable with virtual asset ETFs”, he added.

The SFC and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority’s joint plan to authorise spot cryptocurrency ETFs has given the industry optimism about the city’s prospects of becoming a cryptocurrency hub.

“Hong Kong’s regulatory environment, known for adaptability, positions it well in navigating the evolving world of digital assets,” said Dmitry Lapidus, senior liquid analyst at US venture capital firm CoinFund.

“Hong Kong is one of the few major jurisdictions in the world that has a clear vision on regulating virtual assets now, and I truly believe this move will continue to serve Hong Kong as a global financial hub in the coming days,” said Kennix Chan, executive director at Victory Securities Company Limited.

But the city will face strong competition from jurisdictions like the US, experts noted.

The American cryptocurrency market is poised to be much larger for US and world investors, especially when the ones offering the spot cryptocurrency ETFs are finance heavyweights such as Blackrock, Fidelity, Franklin, and Invesco, said Jack Poon, professor of practice for fintech and entrepreneurship at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University.

“They have a huge existing customer base and a brand that retail investors feel comfortable with,” Poon said, adding that they are also offering low fees that issuers in Hong Kong may not be able to absorb in the long term.

item.title: Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma praises rural teachers for their educational passion and ‘belief in the future’ in annual address
item.description:
Summary：

Alibaba co-founder Jack Ma has praised the mentality of rural teachers in China and their “belief in the future”, in a message of public support from the increasingly reclusive Chinese billionaire. In a videotaped speech, Ma expressed his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside. He commended their “sincere passion for education” and their commitment to shaping the future of rural students.
  • Abstract: Jack Ma praises rural teachers for their efforts in fostering creativity, curiosity, and confidence among students in challenging conditions.
  • Theme: The dedication and belief in the future of rural teachers in China, despite facing various challenges.
  • Viewpoint: Ma emphasizes the importance of education in rural areas and the crucial role of teachers in shaping the future of rural students.
  • Main information: Ma's admiration for rural teachers, his videotaped speech, and the initiatives he has launched to support rural education.

总结：

阿里巴巴联合创始人马云在公开支持中国农村教师的讯息中，赞扬了他们“对未来的信念”和心态。在视频讲话中，马云对老师们在乡村具有挑战性的条件下，激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的努力表示赞赏。他称赞了他们“对教育的真诚热情”以及他们对塑造农村学生未来的承诺。
  • 摘要：马云赞扬农村教师在困难条件下培养学生创造力、好奇心和自信的努力。
  • 主题：中国农村教师的奉献精神和对未来的信念，尽管他们面临着各种挑战。
  • 观点：马云强调了农村地区教育的重要性，以及教师在塑造农村学生未来方面的重要作用。
  • 主要信息：马云对农村教师的赞扬、他的视频讲话，以及他为支持农村教育而发起的倡议。

单词：

  • excerpts (n.) - /ˈɛksərpt/ 摘录，节选。

    原文例句：Ma, 59, praises their “sincere passion for education” and their “belief in the future”, according to excerpts of his comments issued by the Foundation.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由ex-（出，从）和cerpere（采集）组成，意为“摘录，节选”。在这个例句中，it指的是基金会发布的马云评论摘要，帮助我们了解马云的观点。

  • reclusive (adj.) - /rɪˈkluːsɪv/ 隐居的，与世隔绝的。

    原文例句：Ma, who has maintained a low profile since stepping down as chairman of e-commerce giant Alibaba in 2019, has met with Chinese rural teachers in the run up to the Chinese Lunar New Year for nine years in a row.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由re-（回，返）和claudere（关闭）组成，意为“使封闭，隐居的，与世隔绝的”。在这个例句中，it指的是马云自2019年辞去电子商务巨头阿里巴巴董事长的职务后一直保持低调，连续九年在农历新年来临之际会见中国农村教师。

  • endorse (v.) - /ɪnˈdɔːrs/ 支持，认可。

    原文例句：Jack Ma-backed firm 1.8 Meters starts online sales via Alibaba’s Freshippo and Tmall

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于French，由en（表示方向）和dos（背）组成，意为“在背上写，支持，认可”。在这个例句中，it指的是由马云支持的公司1.8米商店开始在阿里巴巴的盒马鲜生和天猫上进行线上销售。

词组：

  • in the run up to - 在...的准备阶段

    原文例句：Ma, who has maintained a low profile since stepping down as chairman of e-commerce giant Alibaba in 2019, has met with Chinese rural teachers in the run up to the Chinese Lunar New Year for nine years in a row.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），the（表示限定），run（运行，奔跑）和up（向上）构成的，表示“(为某事)做准备，(为某事)进行准备”。在这个例句中，it表示马云自2019年辞去电子商务巨头阿里巴巴董事长的职务后一直保持低调，连续九年在农历新年来临之际会见中国农村教师。

句子：

  • In a videotaped speech issued by the Jack Ma Foundation on Thursday, Ma – a former teacher himself – is seen speaking to a group of rural Chinese teachers, expressing his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside. - 在由马云基金会于周四发布的视频讲话中，马云 - 本身也是一名曾经的老师 - 被看到正在与一群中国农村教师交谈，表达了他对他们努力在乡村具有挑战性的条件下激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的钦佩。

    • 句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是Ma is seen speaking，其中主语是Ma，谓语是被动语态的is seen speaking，宾语是to a group of rural Chinese teachers。a group of rural Chinese teachers是一个介词短语作宾语，表示一群中国农村教师。expressing his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示马云表达了他对他们努力在乡村具有挑战性的条件下激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的钦佩。这个句子的意思是说，在由马云基金会于周四发布的视频讲话中，马云被看到正在与一群中国农村教师交谈，表达了他对他们努力在乡村具有挑战性的条件下激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的钦佩。

语法：

  • 现在分词短语作状语 - 表示动作或状态发生在谓语动词表示的动作之前。

    原文例句：In a videotaped speech issued by the Jack Ma Foundation on Thursday, Ma – a former teacher himself – is seen speaking to a group of rural Chinese teachers, expressing his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside.

    语法讲解：现在分词短语是英语中一种常见的语法结构，用现在分词加上适当的修饰语构成。现在分词短语通常用作状语，表示谓语动词表示的动作或状态发生在谓语动词表示的动作之前。在这个例句中，expressing his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside是一个现在分词短语作状语，表示马云表达了他对他们努力在乡村具有挑战性的条件下激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的钦佩。这个现在分词短语修饰了谓语动词is seen speaking，表示马云表达了他对他们努力在乡村具有挑战性的条件下激发学生创造力、好奇心和信心的钦佩是在他被看到正在与一群中国农村教师交谈之前。

  • 介词短语作宾语 - 表示介词和名词或代词组成的短语作谓语动词的宾语。

    原文例句：Ma, 59, praises their “sincere passion for education” and their “belief in the future”, according to excerpts of his comments issued by the Foundation.

    语法讲解：介词短语作宾语是英语中一种常见的语法结构，用介词和名词或代词组成的短语作谓语动词的宾语。介词短语作宾语通常表示谓语动词的作用对象或结果。在这个例句中，根据基金会发布的他的评论摘录，马云赞扬他们“对教育的真诚热情”和他们“对未来的信念”。according to excerpts of his comments issued by the Foundation是一个介词短语作宾语，表示马云赞扬他们“对教育的真诚热情”和他们“对未来的信念

    • Ma expressses his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students in the countryside
    • Alibaba co-founder Ma has met with rural teachers in the run up to the Chinese Lunar New Year for nine years in a row

    Jack Ma, co-founder of Alibaba Group Holding, has praised the mentality of rural teachers in China and their “belief in the future”, in a message of public support from the increasingly reclusive Chinese billionaire.

    In a videotaped speech issued by the Jack Ma Foundation on Thursday, Ma – a former teacher himself – is seen speaking to a group of rural Chinese teachers, expressing his admiration for their efforts to bring out the creativity, curiosity and confidence of students amid challenging conditions in the countryside.

    Ma, 59, praises their “sincere passion for education” and their “belief in the future”, according to excerpts of his comments issued by the Foundation.

    Ma, who has maintained a low profile since stepping down as chairman of e-commerce giant Alibaba in 2019, has met with Chinese rural teachers in the run up to the Chinese Lunar New Year for nine years in a row.

    Jack Ma-backed firm 1.8 Meters starts online sales via Alibaba’s Freshippo and Tmall

    The Jack Ma Rural Teachers Initiative and Jack Ma Rural Teachers Award were officially launched on September 16, 2015. Every year, 100 outstanding rural teachers are shortlisted and granted 100,000 yuan (US$14,260) each to support rural education, according to the Foundation’s website. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

    In recent years Ma has advocated for agricultural and educational development, as well as environmental protection. Ma, who signed off with a guitar and a rock star wig at a farewell event for thousands of employees in 2019, has pursued several educational causes, including the Rural Principal Initiative, launched in 2016, and the Pre-Service Teachers and Rural School Initiative, both launched in 2017.

    The projects have fostered 120 rural principals, enlisted 800 pre-service teachers, and revamped 63 boarding schools in rural areas.

item.title: TikTok owner ByteDance allows employees to cash in stock options earlier under new payroll policy
item.description:
English Summary：

  • ByteDance, the owner of TikTok and Douyin, has revised its payroll policy to expedite employees' access to stock options and standardize bonuses.
  • Under the new policy, employees receive 20% of their total stock awards after their first year, increasing to 25% after the second and third years, and the remaining shares after the fourth year, with a quarterly vesting schedule.
  • Annual bonuses are now standardized to three months' salary in cash, with additional merit-based bonuses and equity.

中文总结：

  • TikTok和抖音的所有者字节跳动调整了工资政策，以加快员工行权速度并标准化奖金。
  • 根据新政策，员工在第一年服务后收到总股票奖励的20%，第二年和第三年增加到25%，剩余股票在第四年后归属，并按照季度进行归属。
  • 年度奖金现在标准化为三个月的工资，以现金发放，并根据绩效和股票形式发放额外的奖金。

单词：

  • standardize (v.) - /ˈstændəˌdaɪz/ 标准化，使标准化。

    原文例句：Annual bonuses have been standardised to three months worth of salary, all granted in cash, with additional sums to be given on merit

    例句讲解：这个单词是由stand（立场，位置）和ardize（使成标准）构成的，表示“使成标准，使标准化”。在这个例句中，它表示年度奖金被标准化为三个月工资，全部以现金发放，并根据绩效发放额外的奖金。

  • vest (v.) - /vɛst/ 归属，赋予所有权。

    原文例句：Thereafter, stock grants will be vested on a quarterly basis rather than annually, as was previously the case.

    例句讲解：这个单词表示“使某人拥有某物的权利或所有权，归属”。在这个例句中，它表示股票授予将在季度基础上进行归属，而不是像以前一样每年进行归属。

词组：

  • vesting schedule - 归属时间表，归属计划。

    原文例句：The four-year time-based vesting schedule is commonly adopted by businesses to encourage staff to stay longer.

    例句讲解：这个词组表示“归属时间表，归属计划”。在这个例句中，它表示四年为基础的时间归属计划通常被企业用来鼓励员工留任更长时间。

句子：

  • In December, the unicorn offered to buy back up to US$5 billion worth of shares from existing investors, valuing it at US$268 billion, or about 10 per cent lower than a year earlier when ByteDance organised a US$3 billion share buy-back for earlier investors, the Post reported. - 据《南华早报》报道，去年12月，这家独角兽企业提出回购现有投资者价值高达50亿美元的股份，估值2680亿美元，比字节跳动一年前为早期投资者组织的30亿美元股份回购低约10%。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是ByteDance organised a US$3 billion share buy-back for earlier investors，其中主语是ByteDance，谓语是organised，宾语是a US$3 billion share buy-back for earlier investors。In December, the unicorn offered to buy back up to US$5 billion worth of shares from existing investors, valuing it at US$268 billion, or about 10 per cent lower than a year earlier是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示去年12月，这家独角兽企业提出回购现有投资者价值高达50亿美元的股份，估值2680亿美元，比字节跳动一年前为早期投资者组织的30亿美元股份回购低约10%。这个句子的意思是说，据《南华早报》报道，去年12月，这家独角兽企业提出回购现有投资者价值高达50亿美元的股份，估值2680亿美元，比字节跳动一年前为早期投资者组织的30亿美元股份回购低约10%。

语法：

  • 定语从句 - 用于修饰或限定名词或代词的从句。

    原文例句：Annual bonuses have been standardised to three months worth of salary, all granted in cash, with additional sums to be given on merit

    语法讲解：这是一个定语从句，修饰名词bonuses，其中关系词是worth，先行词是three months。这个从句表示年度奖金被标准化为三个月工资，全部以现金发放，并根据绩效发放额外的奖金。

  • 非谓语动词 - 不能单独作谓语的动词形式。

    原文例句：The four-year time-based vesting schedule is commonly adopted by businesses to encourage staff to stay longer.

    语法讲解：这是一个非谓语动词，由现在分词staying和不定式to stay longer构成，作目的语，其逻辑主语是staff。这个非谓语动词表示员工留任更长时间。

  • Under the new rule, staff will receive 20 per cent of their total stock awards after their first year of service, up from 15 per cent previously
  • Annual bonuses have been standardised to three months worth of salary, all granted in cash, with additional sums to be given on merit

ByteDance, owner of global short video hit TikTok and its Chinese sibling Douyin, has adjusted its payroll policy to allow employees to sell their stock options faster, as plans for an initial public offering (IPO) remain in limbo.

Under the new rule, applicable to ByteDance’s 110,000 employees worldwide, workers will receive 20 per cent of their total stock awards after their first year of service, up from 15 per cent previously, according to two people briefed on the matter on Thursday.

Thereafter, stock grants will be vested on a quarterly basis rather than annually, as was previously the case. Workers will get 25 per cent of their equity grants after the second year, and again in the third year, with all remaining shares to be vested after the fourth year.

ByteDance did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

TikTok owner ByteDance spent 2023 cutting the fat, but fresh challenges loom

The four-year time-based vesting schedule is commonly adopted by businesses to encourage staff to stay longer. As ByteDance remains a private firm, the only way for staff to cash in their stock options is to sell to their employer.

The Beijing-based company’s share buy-back programme has taken place twice a year since 2017. The most recent one, in November, priced the stock at US$160 per share.

In its latest reform, ByteDance also standardised its annual bonuses to three months worth of salary, all granted in cash, with additional sums to be given on merit and in equity form. Previously, employees had been allowed to decide if they wanted their bonuses to be given entirely or partially in cash.

The change affects thousands of employees who are used to receiving higher bonuses, such as product design and optimisation staff whose bonuses had reached the level of six months’ salary. To offset the impact, the company has promised product managers pay rises.

The new policy has generated mixed reactions among employees at China’s most-valuable start-up.

One person said some staff may be happy to find more flexibility if they are considering a job change in the middle of the year. Another person said now that employees could not receive all bonuses as stock options, they could be charged higher income taxes.

Prospects for a ByteDance IPO remain uncertain amid intense scrutiny in the US over TikTok’s ties to China, as well as challenges in other overseas markets.

At home, ByteDance has retreated from the video gaming sector. It confirmed earlier this month that it was in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent Holdings, to sell its video-game operations.

In December, the unicorn offered to buy back up to US$5 billion worth of shares from existing investors, valuing it at US$268 billion, or about 10 per cent lower than a year earlier when ByteDance organised a US$3 billion share buy-back for earlier investors, the Post reported.

item.title: World Economic Forum: CATL’s Robin Zeng calls for setting aside geopolitical tensions to address EV battery materials shortage
item.description:
Summary：

CATL founder, Zeng Yuqun, calls for international cooperation in battery recycling to address material shortages and tackle climate change. He highlights China's leadership in battery recycling and expresses willingness to share technologies to manage mining issues. The transition to electric vehicles requires technological innovation, a sustainable supply chain, and concerted efforts to mitigate geopolitical tensions and reduce dependency on critical materials.
  • Abstract: Promoting battery recycling collaboration to secure critical materials for electric vehicle production and combat climate change.
  • Theme: Global cooperation in battery recycling to ensure a resilient supply chain for electric vehicles and address the climate crisis.
  • Viewpoint: The urgency of setting aside geopolitical issues to accelerate innovation and facilitate technology sharing in battery recycling.
  • Main information: Zeng's call for collaboration in battery recycling; China's advanced battery recycling technologies and capacity; geopolitical tensions affecting CATL's business; the potential of sodium-ion batteries and cobalt-free cathode materials.

总结：

宁德时代创始人曾毓群呼吁国际社会在电池回收方面进行合作，以解决材料短缺问题并应对气候变化。他强调了中国在电池回收方面的领先地位，并表示愿意分享技术以解决采矿问题。向电动汽车的过渡需要技术创新、可持续的供应链和共同努力，以缓解地缘政治紧张局势并减少对关键材料的依赖。
  • 摘要：促进电池回收协作，以确保电动汽车生产的关键材料供应并应对气候变化。
  • 主题：在电池回收方面进行全球合作，确保电动汽车的弹性供应链并应对气候危机。
  • 观点：为了加速电池回收领域的创新并促进技术共享，必须紧迫地搁置地缘政治问题。
  • 主要信息：曾毓群呼吁在电池回收方面进行合作；中国先进的电池回收技术和能力；地缘政治紧张局势影响宁德时代业务；钠离子电池和无钴正极材料的潜力。

单词：

  • collaboration (n.) - /kəˌlæbəˈreɪʃən/ 协作，合作。

    原文例句：Countries – from government leaders to businesses and non-governmental organisations – must collaborate to accelerate innovation in the EV battery industry.

    例句讲解：collaboration一词由co-（共同）和labor（劳动）构成，含义是“共同劳动，协作”。在这个句子中，collaboration指的是政府、企业和非政府组织等各方共同努力，共同推进电动汽车电池行业的创新。

  • resilient (adj.) - /rɪˈzɪl.jənt/ 有弹性的，坚韧的。

    原文例句：Countries – from government leaders to businesses and non-governmental organisations – must collaborate to accelerate innovation in the EV battery industry to ensure a resilient supply chain.

    例句讲解：resilient一词源自拉丁语，含义是“有弹性的，坚韧的”。在这个句子中，resilient指的是电动汽车电池供应链具有很强的弹性，能够抵抗各种冲击或压力。

  • decarbonise (v.) - /diːˈkɑːb.ə.naɪz/ 使脱碳，减少碳排放。

    原文例句：As an essential part of decarbonising the automotive ecosystem, the EV transition requires technological innovation, a sustainable and responsible supply chain and the concerted efforts of all stakeholders.

    例句讲解：decarbonise一词由de-（消除）和carbon（碳）构成，含义是“使脱碳，减少碳排放”。在这个句子中，decarbonise指的是电动汽车行业的转型需要通过技术创新、可持续的供应链和各方共同努力来减少碳排放。

词组：

  • set aside - 搁置，放一边。

    原文例句：Geopolitical tensions must be set aside as the world faces shortages of critical battery materials such as lithium, nickel, and cobalt due to surging demand.

    例句讲解：set aside一词由set（放置）和aside（一旁）构成，含义是“搁置，放一边”。在这个句子中，set aside指的是世界各国应该搁置地缘政治紧张局势，共同应对电池材料短缺的问题。

  • persistent shortages - 持续的短缺。

    原文例句：Governments and carmakers are increasingly concerned about the persistent shortages of lithium, nickel and cobalt, which could put the net-zero transition under threat.

    例句讲解：persistent shortages一词由persistent（持续的）和shortages（短缺）构成，含义是“持续的短缺”。在这个句子中，persistent shortages指的是锂、镍、钴等电池材料的持续短缺。

  • at lower costs - 以较低的成本。

    原文例句：Finding an alternative at lower costs, such as sodium-ion batteries or cobalt-free cathode materials, is also a solution for reducing dependency on critical materials such as lithium.

    例句讲解：at lower costs一词由at（在）和lower costs（较低的成本）构成，含义是“以较低的成本”。在这个句子中，at lower costs指的是以较低的成本找到替代方案，例如钠离子电池或无钴正极材料，以减少对锂等关键材料的依赖。

句子：

  • Geopolitical tensions must be set aside as the world faces shortages of critical battery materials such as lithium, nickel and cobalt due to surging demand. - 鉴于世界面临锂、镍和钴等关键电池材料的需求激增而导致的短缺，地缘政治紧张局势必须被搁置。

    句子分析：这句话是一个复句，包含两个分句。主句是Geopolitical tensions must be set aside，其中主语是Geopolitical tensions，谓语是must be set aside。从句是as the world faces shortages of critical battery materials such as lithium, nickel and cobalt due to surging demand，其中主语是the world，谓语是faces shortages of critical battery materials such as lithium, nickel and cobalt due to surging demand。这句话的意思是，鉴于世界面临锂、镍和钴等关键电池材料的需求激增而导致的短缺，地缘政治紧张局势必须被搁置。

语法：

  • 分词短语 - 可以作定语或状语。

    原文例句：CATL showcased its ‘Superfast Charging Battery Shenxing’ at the 2023 International Motor Show in Munich, in this file photo from September last year. Photo: Xinhua

    语法讲解：分词短语是由分词和它所修饰的成分构成的，可以作定语或状语。在这个句子中，由分词showcased和它所修饰的宾语“Superfast Charging Battery Shenxing”构成的分词短语showcase its ‘Superfast Charging Battery Shenxing’作谓语动词showcase的定语，说明showcase的是什么。由分词from和它所修饰的成分“September last year”构成的分词短语from September last year作状语，说明file photo的时间。

  • ‘We are fighting climate change … so whatever the geopolitical issues are, we have to find a way,’ CATL founder tells Davos panel
  • By 2042, China will no longer need to mine new mineral materials because of its mature battery recycling market: Zeng

Geopolitical tensions must be set aside as the world faces shortages of critical battery materials such as lithium, nickel and cobalt due to surging demand, said Robin Zeng Yuqun, founder of Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd (CATL), the world’s largest manufacturer of batteries for electric vehicles (EVs).

Countries – from government leaders to businesses and non-governmental organisations – must collaborate to accelerate innovation in the EV battery industry to ensure a resilient supply chain, reduce dependency on critical metals and decarbonise the transport sector to tackle the climate crisis, Zeng told the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos.

“We should really avoid any geopolitical issues in [battery] recycling technologies,” he said during a panel on Wednesday. “If we can provide these recycling technologies to Europe, to the US and to the rest of the world, it’d be very easy to manage mining issues.

“The demand for critical materials might increase by five times in the next 10 years, considering the fast growth of the industry. But at the end of the day, when we achieve 100 per cent electric cars, there will be very tiny amounts of new critical materials to be mined.”

China leads the world in battery recycling technologies, an important solution for addressing battery material shortages.

For instance, Zeng told the forum that CATL currently has the capacity to recycle as much as 99.6 per cent of precious metals such as nickel, cobalt and manganese, and up to 91 per cent of lithium, higher than Europe’s capacity of 70 per cent to 80 per cent. Last year, CATL recycled 100,000 tonnes of waste batteries through its subsidiary Brump to create 13,000 tonnes of lithium carbonate, he said.

EV battery giant CATL to open research and development centre in Hong Kong

But CATL’s business has been affected by the fraught relations between Beijing and the West. In December, for instance, CATL was accused of posing a national security threat in the US and was banned from a US military base. The allegation was based on a letter from US lawmakers led by Republican senator Marco Rubio that said CATL enjoyed a close relationship with the Chinese leadership in Beijing.

“We are fighting climate change … so whatever the geopolitical issues are, we have to find a way,” Zeng said during the panel.

As sales of EVs continue to break records around the world, governments and carmakers are increasingly concerned about the persistent shortages of lithium, nickel and cobalt, which could put the net-zero transition under threat.

CATL to make battery offering 400km driving range from 10-minute charge

S&P Global forecast that a more than 270 per cent increase in lithium production levels is needed to meet the estimated demand from the EV battery sector by 2030. Nickel and cobalt are also expected to be critical, but to a lesser degree as the deployment of iron-based chemistries will remedy their potential shortage, it said.

The Fujian-based company is willing to share its technologies and help overseas carmakers address their battery shortages, Zeng said. By 2042, China will no longer need to mine new mineral materials because of its mature battery recycling market, he added.

CATL is increasingly expanding its capacity overseas with plants in Germany and Hungary. It is also partnering with Amsterdam-based multinational carmaker Stellantis and Ford Motor to build battery factories in Europe and Michigan in the US.

As an essential part of decarbonising the automotive ecosystem, the EV transition requires technological innovation, a sustainable and responsible supply chain and the concerted efforts of all stakeholders, Zeng said during another panel on Thursday.

Advancing mining and refinery technology helps to increase the supply of lithium and to alleviate shortages, he said. Increasing energy density helps improve material efficiency and therefore reduces the demand for raw materials.

Finding an alternative at lower costs, such as sodium-ion batteries or cobalt-free cathode materials, is also a solution for reducing dependency on critical materials such as lithium, he said.

According to Zeng, CATL introduced its first generation of sodium-ion batteries in 2021 and is currently working on its second generation, which will give cars a driving range of 400 to 500 kilometres per charge.

item.title: How China is making its dream of flying cars, drones and sky cities come true
item.description:
English Summary：

  • China's government is fostering the development of a "low altitude economy" by supporting the advancement of flying cars and other low-altitude aircraft.
  • Companies like Xpeng are developing flying vehicles that can seamlessly transition between road and air travel.
  • China's policy support, financial investments, and infrastructural development are creating a conducive ecosystem for the growth of the low-altitude economy.
  • Shenzhen, China's tech hub, is leading the way with plans to build a "city in the sky" and a grid of landing/take-off stations for low-altitude aircraft.
  • Government regulations aim to standardize construction, coordinate airspace management, and ensure safety in the low-altitude economy.
  • China's low-altitude economy has the potential to serve as a model for the world in integrating advanced aerial technologies into daily life and urban planning.

中文总结：

  • 中国政府通过支持发展飞行汽车等低空飞行器，来推动低空经济的发展。
  • 小鹏等公司正在开发可实现陆空无缝转换的飞行汽车。
  • 中国出台政策支持、提供资金投资、完善基础设施，打造有利于低空经济发展的生态环境。
  • 中国科技之都深圳还计划建设“空中之城”并铺设低空飞行器起降平台，引领了全国的低空经济发展。
  • 中国政府发布低空经济相关的政策法规，对低空飞行设施建设、空域管理和飞行服务、安全管理等方面进行规范。
  • 中国低空经济的发展为世界提供了榜样，借鉴了将先进空技术整合到日常生活及城市规划中。

单词：

  • unveiled (v.) - /ʌnˈveɪld/ - 公布，宣传。

    原文例句：“The company last week unveiled a new product, which is a foldable smartphone.” 上周公司发布了一款新产品，折叠智能手机。

    例句讲解：unveiled 的意思是“揭幕；公开” ，public-private合作是公众-私有公司的合作，也就是揭露公众和私有公司的合作助推了低空飞行汽车的研究与发展。所以Unveiled 与 public-private 合作可以解释为揭露了公众-私有公司的合作助推了低空飞行汽车的研究与发展。

  • ecosystem (n.) - /ˈiːkəʊsɪstəm/ - 生态系统。

    原文例句：“The company has built a strong ecosystem of partners and suppliers.” 公司建立了一个强大的合作伙伴和供应商生态系统。

    例句讲解：ecosystem 的意思是“生态系统；环境”，所以Policy, financial and infrastructural support is creating a conducive ecosystem for China’s ‘low altitude economy’，integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning. 可以解释为：政策，资金和基础设施支持为中国“低空经济”创造了一个有利的生态系统，将先进的航空技术整合到日常生活中和城市规划中。

  • integration (n.) - /ˌɪntɪˈɡreɪʃ(ə)n/ - 整合。

    原文例句：“The company is working on the integration of its new product with its existing product line.” 公司正在努力将新产品与其现有产品线相结合。

    例句讲解：integration 的意思是“整合；结合”，所以Integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning 可以解释为将先进的航空技术整合到日常生活和城市规划中。

词组：

  • low-altitude economy - 低空经济

    • 原文例句：There are tremendous opportunities in the low-altitude economy.

    例句讲解：low-altitude economy 是指低空经济。Policy, financial and infrastructural support is creating a conducive ecosystem for China’s ‘low altitude economy’,integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning. 可以解释为：政策，资金和基础设施支持为中国“低空经济”创造了一个有利的生态系统，将先进的航空技术整合到日常生活中和城市规划中。

  • advanced aerial tech - 先进的航空技术

    • 原文例句：The company is developing advanced aerial tech for its new product.

    例句讲解：advanced aerial tech 是指先进的航空技术。Policy, financial and infrastructural support is creating a conducive ecosystem for China’s ‘low altitude economy’,integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning. 可以解释为：政策，资金和基础设施支持为中国“低空经济”创造了一个有利的生态系统，将先进的航空技术整合到日常生活中和城市规划中。

  • urban planning - 城市规划

    • 原文例句：The company is working on a new project for urban planning.

    例句讲解：urban planning 是指城市规划。Policy, financial and infrastructural support is creating a conducive ecosystem for China’s ‘low altitude economy’,integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning. 可以解释为：政策，资金和基础设施支持为中国“低空经济”创造了一个有利的生态系统，将先进的航空技术整合到日常生活中和城市规划中。

句子：

  • China has highlighted the low-altitude economy as a core industry, deserving of special attention, at its annual central economic work conference last month. - 上个月，中国政府在年度中央经济工作会议上强调了低空经济是值得特别关注的核心产业。

    • 句子分析：China has highlighted the low-altitude economy as a core industry, deserving of special attention, at its annual central economic work conference last month. 是一个复合句，主句是China has highlighted the low-altitude economy as a core industry，其中主语是China，谓语是has highlighted，宾语是the low-altitude economy as a core industry。副词短语last month修饰谓语动词has highlighted，表示上个月这一动作的发生时间。at its annual central economic work conference 是一个介词短语，作地点状语，表示在年度中央经济工作会议上。deserving of special attention是一个现在分词短语，作定语，修饰the low-altitude economy，表示值得特别关注。这个句子的意思是，中国政府在上个月举行的年度中央经济工作会议上，将低空经济视为一个值得特别关注的核心产业。

语法：

  • There be句型 - 表示存在

    • 原文例句：There are tremendous opportunities in the low-altitude economy.

    语法讲解：There be句型是一种常用的句型，表示某地或某时存在某物或某人。结构是：There + be + 主语 + 其他。其中be要根据主语的数和时态进行变化，主语一般是名词或代词。在这个例句中，be用的是are，表示现在时态，主语是opportunities，表示机会。这个句子的意思是，低空经济中有巨大的机会。

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作或状态

    • 原文例句：The company is working on the integration of its new product with its existing product line.

    语法讲解：现在进行时是一种时态，结构是：be + 现在分词。其中be根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。现在进行时表示动作或状态正在进行中，强调动作或状态的持续性。在这个例句中，be是is，表示第三人称单数，现在分词是working，表示正在进行的动作。这个句子的意思是，该公司正在努力将新产品与其现有产品线相结合。

  • Policy, financial and infrastructural support is creating a conducive ecosystem for China’s ‘low altitude economy’, integrating advanced aerial tech into everyday life and urban planning

The CES 2024 consumer electronics show in Las Vegas last week mesmerised tech observers from around the world with more than 4,000 exhibitors, from start-ups to tech giants. Over 1,000 companies were from China, demonstrating the country’s impressive contributions to global technology.

In particular spotlight was China’s electric vehicle (EV) industry, after China was recently crowned the world’s largest car exporter, accounting for about half of global EV sales. At the tech showcase, Xpeng astonished with its “flying car”, the AeroHT eVTOL.

Built sleekly in the shape of a sports car, with propellers that unfurl, the futuristic vehicle evoked visions of flying vehicles seen in films such as Star Wars and The Fifth Element. The model, thought to be years away from broad use, completed a successful test flight in October 2022.

At CES, Xpeng also showcased its Land Aircraft Carrier, which comes with a separate aircraft that launches from the car, for which the company will take pre-orders in the fourth quarter this year, with deliveries to start a year later.

The Chinese government is keen for companies to continue making leaps in flying vehicle technology and last year announced a “green aviation” development plan, including for electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft, or eVTOL. This is part of an official strategy to support a “low altitude economy”.

The low-altitude economy refers to a comprehensive realm of industries centred around civil-manned and unmanned aerial vehicles, including manufacturing, low-altitude flight operations and integrated services.

China’s green aviation plan presented actionable items to boost the innovation and deployment of flying cars. Important measures include setting up economic demonstration zones and test bases for low-flying aircraft. The plan includes the construction of infrastructure to integrate flying vehicles into urban transport and the daily commute.

While US flying car companies such as Kittyhawk (backed by Google founder Larry Page) shut down in 2022 due to commercialising and scaling difficulties, China’s policy support is fostering a more conducive ecosystem for nascent technologies like this to advance and benefit society.

Xpeng’s AeroHT eVTOL, for instance, unlike other flying vehicles such as by German company Volocopter and Hyundai’s Supernal, which was showcased at CES 2024, can transform between terrestrial and aerial modes.

While the inventions by Volocopter and Supernal resemble personal helicopters, Xpeng’s AeroHT eVTOL has propellers that emerge in flying mode and fold into the car’s body after use. This allows it to navigate road traffic and fit into a standard car park space.

Another factor that enhances the research and development of flying cars in China is close public-private collaboration. For instance, in 2021, the Guangdong government invested 500 million yuan (US$70 million) in Xpeng. Guangdong’s Zhaoqing city has also supported Xpeng’s expansion, last year signing an investment agreement for a project worth 2 billion yuan. This type of financial and infrastructural support creates a nurturing ecosystem that enables Chinese EV makers to quickly transform concept cars into mass products.

China has highlighted the low-altitude economy as a core industry, deserving of special attention, at its annual central economic work conference last month, together with artificial intelligence, the digital economy, green energy, biomedicine and private space flight. The vision is for China to address its economic challenges by investing in technology and industry, unlocking the country’s growth potential.

In addition to flying cars, drones are another area of China’s low-altitude economy that promises to revolutionise its agriculture, delivery services, emergency responses and more. Already, Shenzhen, China’s hi-tech hub, has declared plans to build itself a “city in the sky”.

China’s DJI is the world’s largest drone manufacturer with 70 per cent of the global market share. Its drone technology has helped in the automation of farming, including planning, sowing, weeding, watering and monitoring crop growth. Food delivery platform Meituan, for example, has embraced drones, speeding up its commercial transactions and slashing its labour cost. In 2022, the drone industry in Shenzhen alone generated a market value of 75 billion yuan.

Shenzhen is building a grid of over 600 landing/take-off stations for low-altitude aircraft from by 2025. This will facilitate their deployment and reduce operational costs for companies. Infrastructural support is essential in this industry, especially when the aim is to promote widespread public usage.

With more companies developing flying cars and other low-altitude aircraft in China, industry regulation is also maturing. This year, Shenzhen announced China’s first regulations over the low-altitude economy. Effective from February 1, these regulations aim to standardise the construction of low-altitude flight infrastructure, coordinate the management of low-altitude airspace and flight services, and set safety standards.

The rise of Shenzhen, from seaside town to China’s Silicon Valley

They stipulate the construction of a low-altitude flight service platform, providing services like flight approval applications, intelligent flight monitoring and message alerts to units or individuals conducting low-altitude flight activities.

The fierce market competition in China’s EV industry has certainly contributed to the industry’s exponential growth. But China’s institutional support also plays a role in quickly making hi-tech advancements accessible to ordinary citizens, and not just a few privileged individuals.

Although there are still gaps between the big cities and the underdeveloped areas, China’s policy principle that new technologies should improve people’s lives and livelihoods makes for a promising future.

The development of China’s low-altitude economy could serve as an inspirational model for the world, showing the potential for the integration of advanced aerial technologies into everyday life and urban planning.

Gerui Wang is a visiting scholar at Stanford University
